" History ," " officials ", " what ", " make " this is the word of differentiation. Oracle from " hand " from " ◎ ", like the hand holds. ("Ancient Chinese Characters Genealogy Notes") There are different opinions about " ◎ ". For example, Wu Qichang thought that " ◎ " is like a hand holding a flag (flag), which is extended to have the meaning of a deacon. Wang Guowei thought of " ◎ " as a tool like Shengjie (brief book). Ma Xulun thinks that " ◎ " is like a hand holding a pen, meaning it can remember things. Chen Mengjia believes that " ◎ " is a tool for hunting like fields. Xu Zhongshu thinks that the " historical " elephant wields a hunting gear with a branch on its top to fight wild animals.

"Shu Wen" believes that the original meaning of " history " is a recorder. "Shuowen": "History is the recorder." Judging from ancient written materials and handed down documents, the nature of " history " in the pre-Qin period should be very extensive. (Ji Xusheng) Wang Guowei, "Shi Shi": "The original meaning of "History" is the person who holds the book. It is extended to be the name of high official and general, and it is also extended to the name of ministry. The latter three require special characters. , So the three characters "history", "officials", and "things" are completely different in Xiaozhuan: the holder of the book is called "history", the person who governs is called "the official", and the ministry is called "thing". This cover From the Qin and Han dynasties, there is not much difference between "Poems" and "Books." See also " official ", " things " and " make ".

The " History " in Oracle can indicate official names. For example, "Collection" 27125: "Da Yi History, Wang Qixiang (飨)." "Da Yi History" is dedicated to Da Yi officials. It also expresses the name of a clan or person, such as "Heji" 3226: "Ren Shen Shi Shi Tun." It also expresses things, such as "He Ji" 25: "Ling Zhong [午 Jie] (御)史." It also means Shi, such as "Collection" 5544: "History went to Tang."

Bronze writing is mainly used as official name. For example, Nei Shi Lu Ding: "In Nei Shi Lu (Gong), my heavenly monarch, his tens of thousands of years are used as Kao Bao [阝 Zun]." Song Ding: "Wang Hu (Hu) Shi Guo Sheng Book Order (Fate) Song." Also used as a clan name , Such as Shi Zun: "History." In addition, " History " is also used as " things ", such as [亻左]匜: "Since today I dare to (disturb) is a small history (thing)." It is also used as " the "earthenware vessel as in:" I make women (Ru) history (the) small big bang. "

" History " in handed down documents mostly expresses official names, mainly serving as sacrificial rites, divination, and record keeping. Such as "Zuo Zhuan. "The Twenty-five Years of Xianggong": "The Nanshi clan has heard of the great history to death, and keeps it simple. After hearing the book, it is returned." "Zhou Li. Chunguan. "Internal History": "Internal History holds the king's eight-fold method, ruled by the edict."

" History " also means history or history books. Such as "Mencius. "Li Louxia": "The story is Qihuan and Jin Wen, and the article is history." "Historical Records. Preface to Taishigong: "Since he received Lin, it has been more than four hundred years old, and the princes are the same, and the historical records are not allowed."

humanum_full_description:
「史」、「吏」、「事」、「使」本為一字分化。甲骨文從「手」從「◎」，象手有所持。（《古文字譜系疏證》）所持之「◎」有不同說法。如吳其昌以為「◎」象手執旂（旗幟）之形，引伸為有執事之義。王國維以為「◎」象盛筴（簡冊）之器。馬敍倫以為「◎」象手執筆形，會記事之意。陳夢家認為「◎」象田獵之工具。徐中舒則以為「史」象持上端有杈之捕獵器具以搏取野獸。

　　《說文》以為「史」的本義是記事者。《說文》：「史，記事者也。」從古文字材料和傳世文獻來看，先秦時「史」的性質應該很廣泛。（季旭昇）王國維〈釋史〉：「『史』之本義為持書之人，引申而為大官及庶官之稱，又引申為職事之稱。其後三者，各需專字，於是『史』、『吏』、『事』三字於小篆中截然有別：持書者謂之『史』，治人者謂之『吏』，職事謂之『事』。此蓋出於秦漢之際，而《詩》、《書》之文尚不甚區別。」可備一說。參見「吏」、「事」和「使」。

　　甲骨文的「史」可表示官名。如《合集》27125：「大乙史，王其鄉（饗）。」「大乙史」即專祭大乙的官。又表示族名或人名，如《合集》3226臼：「壬申史示屯。」又表示事情，如《合集》25：「令眾[午卩]（御）史。」還表示使，如《合集》5544：「史人往于唐。」

　　金文主要用作官名。如內史龏鼎：「內史龏（恭）朕天君，其萬年用為考寶[阝尊]。」頌鼎：「王乎（呼）史虢生冊令（命）頌。」又用作族名，如史尊：「史。」此外，「史」也用為「事」，如[亻賸]匜：「自今余敢夒（擾）乃小大史（事）。」又用為「使」，如中甗：「余令女（汝）史（使）小大邦。」

　　傳世文獻「史」多表示官名，主要擔任祭祀、卜筮、記事等職。如《左傳．襄公二十五年》：「南史氏聞大史盡死，執簡以往。聞既書矣，乃還。」《周禮．春官．內史》：「內史掌王之八枋之法，以詔王治。」

　　「史」還表示歷史或史書。如《孟子．離婁下》：「其事則齊桓、晉文，其文則史。」《史記．太史公自序》：「自獲麟以來四百有餘歲，而諸侯相兼，史記放絕。」

史字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shǐ］
［《廣韻》疎士切，上止，生。］
(1)古官名。职别各异。㈠殷代为驻守于外的武官。卜辞：“在北史其獲羌。”㈡在王左右的史官，担任祭祀、星历、卜筮、记事等职。《书·金縢》：“史乃册祝？”《周礼·春官·占人》：“﹝凡卜簭﹞史占墨，卜人占坼。”《礼记·玉藻》：“動則左史書之，言則右史書之。”㈢下级佐史。《诗·小雅·宾之初筵》：“或佐之史。”毛传：“佐酒之史。”《周礼·天官·宰夫》：“六曰史，掌官書以贊治。”郑玄注：“贊治，若今起文書草也。”《汉书·百官公卿表》：“百石以下，有斗食、佐史之秩，是爲少吏。”
(2)史册；历史。
(3)虚饰；浮夸。
(4)指画师。
(5)《史记》的省称。
(6)通“使”。
(7)姓。汉有史游。著《急就篇》。

史字的起名意思

：本义为史官。指自然界和人类社会的发展过程，亦指记述、研究这些的文字和学科。
